question: Edward Blake--63 years old, six-two, 225. A solid 225, guy was built like a linebacker. This is plate glass too, you'd have to step on the gas just to put a crack in this. Had to be a two man job. At least. You check the bedroom?
answer: Drawers were open, tossed through. Mattress flipped.

question: Robbery?
answer: Or made to look like one. Found that in the bedroom. Det. Fine studies it. It's Blake's UNITED NATIONS ID. It reads "Special Advisor, United States." You see this? He picks up a PHOTO from the floor, hands it to Fine. Shaking hands with the President.

question: You're saying this guy was a spook? You think this might be a political murder?
answer: I think that this is way bigger than the both of us. He leaves Det. Fine to ponder this.

question: See, the Comedian thought he had it all worked out. He was young and arrogant, but what he lacked in experience, he made up for in . tenacity. As he speaks, we PAN ACROSS various FRAMED MEMORABILIA Guess I was that way too, when I started. I'll never know what possessed me to put that mask on the first time. It started with the villains, y'know, people forget that. Pirate outfits, ghosts. Gangs that thought it was funny to dress up and pull heists, crap like that. PAN ACROSS So a few cops, we decide it might be funny to mask up too. Be anonymous. Take these guys on at the street level, right? Then the media got wind, ran with it, turned it into a whole different beast. PAN ACROSS Superheroes, Supervillians--you know who I ran into the other day at the market? The Screaming Skull. We chatted for a while. Turns out he's a born again. All the nuts that started popping up, I'll tell ya. Who was that midget you and your partner chased down years ago? What'd he call himself?
answer: The Big Figure.

question: Big Figure. A midget bad guy. Guess it doesn't get lower than that, does it? Hollis laughs at his own joke; Dan chuckles, polite.
answer: Wow, it's really late. Dan stands, finishes his beer. Hollis sees him to the door.

question: Well, even though I spent my time catching real bad guys, you were still a better Nite Owl than I ever was.
answer: That's bullshit, Hollis, and you know it. They hug.

question: Rorschach. Rorschach sits at the table, mask half up, eating a cold CAN
answer: Hello Daniel. I helped myself to some beans. You don't mind?

question: No, of course not. You uh, want me to heat some up for you?
answer: No need.

question: You were on the news. They say you attacked a cop.
answer: Minor wound. Won't need hospitalization.

question: Other than that . How have you been keeping?
answer: Out of prison. So far. Look at this. He tosses Blake's happy face pin onto the table. Dan picks it up, runs his fingers over the RED-BROWN SPLOTCH.

question: This little stain, is that bean juice or--
answer: Human bean juice. It belonged to the Comedian. He's dead.

question: The Comedian? Nervous now, Dan glances out the window. DAN Let's talk downstairs. How did it happen?
answer: Murder. Someone threw him out a window.

question: Maybe it was a burglary. The killer might not have known who Blake was.
answer: An ordinary burglar? Kill the Comedian? Ridiculous.

question: You're right. I heard he was working for the government. Maybe it was a political killing.
answer: Maybe. Or maybe someone's decided to kill off costumed heroes.

question: You don't think that's . a little paranoid?
answer: Is that what they're saying about me now? That I'm paranoid?

question: I-'m just saying the Comedian made a lot of enemies over the years, even amongst his friends, if he had any. The man wasn't exactly endearing. Just because something happened to him doesn't mean it involves us.
answer: One of our own has been murdered. I thought you might be interested. An attack on one is an attack on all of us, right? Dan hesitates.

question: I'm out, Rorschach. I've been out, we've all been out. Except you. You know that.
answer: Yes. I know that. Anyways, I thought I'd let you know. Just in case.

question: Yeah, thanks. You can take the tunnel out to the warehouse on Fleet street-- Rorschach turns to walk off down a long, dark TUNNEL.
answer: I remember. Used to come here a lot. Back when we were partners.

question: Yeah. Those were good times, Rorschach. Great times. What ever happened to them?
answer: You quit. Rorschach disappears into the SUBWAY TUNNEL, leaving Dan to reminisce alone. Dan glances at his old costume hanging. Quiet, whore.

question: I'm here to see Adrian Veidt.
answer: Do you have an appointment?

question: No, uh, just tell him Dan Dreiberg is here to see him.
answer: I'm sorry, Mr. Veidt doesn't see anyone without an appointment.

question: I understand, but if you would just tell Adrian that Dan Dreiberg is here, I'm an old friend.
answer: Well, Mr. Veidt is very busy at the

question: Just tell him I'm here. I assure you he'll see me. Dan glares at her. She glares right back. A game of chicken. She reluctantly gets up, goes inside the office. Once she's gone, Dan's glare disappears, replaced by nervousness. Because he's not sure if Adrian will see him-- it's been a long time. He glances at the SECURITY GUARDS eyeing him. Finally, the Assistant returns.
answer: Go on in, Mr. Dreiberg.

question: Predicting stock prices isn't the same as predicting world events. I hope there isn't a war, or even a skirmish for that matter. Because Veidt Enterprises has some exciting plans, plans that will, pardon the cliche, truly make this world a better place. My team of engineers and scientists have been working with Dr. Manhattan himself on synthesizing a new, cheap form of energy which will eliminate the worlds reliance on fossil fuels with no toxic emissions. This energy could power cars, aircrafts, stadiums--there are no limitations-- --but I talk too much. Will you mind pausing the interview a moment, Doug? A good friend of mine is here. Doug Roth leaves. Adrian hugs Dan, despite the sweat.
answer: You look good, Adrian.

question: Dan--it's been far too long. Rorschach. He paid me a visit too.
answer: He did? Must've been tough to get past your security, even for him. I thought your assistant was going to take me out. You're the world's smartest man, Adrian. You tell me.

question: Dr. Manhattan. Dr. Manhattan continues about his business when his girlfriend, LAURIE JUPITER, 30, very much in her prime, enters from the other end.
answer: Jon, did you say some--Rorschach

question: Nice to see you too, Silk Spectre.
answer: Don't call me that. My mother made me take that name. I always hated it.

question: Rorschach--you're upsetting Laurie. I think you ought to go.
answer: I came here to warn you both, just like I warned Adrian and Dan. I believe someone may be targeting masked heroes--

question: I said you ought to go.
answer: It took a lot of effort to get in here. I'm not leaving before I've-- With a look, Dr. Manhattan makes Rorschach disappear. --had my say Rorschach realizes what just happened. Checks himself, his surroundings. Reorients himself. With nothing else he can do, he heads down the road.

question: He's gone. Are you okay now? I'm having trouble with my vision. I can't see clearly what lies ahead. There's some static interference.
answer: Interference? Caused by what?

question: I'm uncertain. A power surge of great magnitude? Perhaps a nuclear detonation.
answer: More war talk. I can't deal with this. I don't want to think about the future right now.

question: There's no such thing as the "future." I've explained to you on many occasions--
answer: --that time is simultaneous. There's no past to travel back to, no future to travel forward to, everything happens all at once, our actions affect the course of time instantly, yes I know.

question: I understand your frustration, Laurie. The human mind for some reason is only capable of viewing time frame by frame. Perhaps you'd find it more comforting if you could perceive time as I do Dr. Manhattan touches her head-- I didn't mean to upset you.
answer: I know. I think I've been cooped up on this base for too long. Rorschach mentioned Dan Dreiberg--we haven't seen him in years. Maybe we can give him a call, see if he's available for dinner tonight.

question: Going somewhere, Miss Jupiter?
answer: Out.

question: I'll have a car brought around in a few minutes.
answer: No, thank you. I called a cab already-- it's waiting for me outside. She tries to walk past but Agent Forbes steps in front of her.

question: You look quite nice. Who are you meeting?
answer: An old friend of mine. And of Dr. Manhattan's. Now step out of my way.

question: Please keep in mind, Ms. Jupiter, that your boyfriend is this country's most valuable asset. You need to keep him happy. And on our side. Laurie glares at him.
answer: Yes, sir. She brushes past him as she leaves. You remember that crazy guy, what did he call himself . Captain Carnage! Pretended to be a supervillian just so he could get beat up all the time?

question: Yes, sir. She brushes past him as she leaves. You remember that crazy guy, what did he call himself . Captain Carnage! Pretended to be a supervillian just so he could get beat up all the time?
answer: Yeah, he tried that with me once. I just walked away but he starts following me down the street in broad daylight yelling, "punish me! punish me!" Uh, well, he pulled that on Rorschach and Rorschach dropped him down an elevator shaft. They look at each other, serious, then explode in laughter.

question: Sorry, sorry, that's not funny. I can't remember the last time I laughed like this. It feels good. Dan looks at her as she finishes her coffee. We can see he's smitten with her and that he probably has been for years. Laurie seems oblivious.
answer: It's great seeing you again, Laurie.

question: Yeah, this was fun. The WAITER arrives with the check; Laurie grabs it.
answer: You sure I can't get that?

question: Let me put my expense account to use. You can thank Uncle Sam.
answer: They've been watching the whole time?

question: Just making sure I'm not doing anything that might upset the country's most powerful weapon.
answer: How is Jon, by the way?

question: I really don't know. It's been harder and harder to tell over the years. It's like his emotions are slowly eroding. To be honest, I can't tell if he even cares about me anymore. They're quiet a moment. Laurie glances at her watch. I should get back. Y1 know, when I think back, why did we do it? Why did we dress up like that? I think the Keene Act was the best thing to ever happen to us.
answer: You're probably right.

question: I mean, you remember my costume? All that tight spandex? That was awful.
answer: Uh, yeah. Awful.

question: And to think my own mother pushed me into that spandex. Pushed me into the whole costume thing in the first place. Wanted her little girl to be just like mommy and fight bad guys. We'll do this again.
answer: Yeah. I'd really like that. Laurie crosses the street and gets into the sedan. As Dan watches the car drive off, TWO KIDS nearly bump into him, running around playing. The Kids make flying noises.

question: Laurie? Is that you? I'd figure you'd be used to traveling that way by now.
answer: Well, I'm not. I hate it when Jon teleports me.

question: Margarita?
answer: No. Sally pours herself a margarita from a pitcher on the counter. We see photos, remnants of Sally from her crimefighting days around the condo. Under the pitcher of margaritas is a days old LA Times with the headline

question: It's Eddie Blake's funeral today, isn't it? Laurie nods. FUNERAL
answer: Poor Eddie? How can you say that? After what he--

question: Fireworks. A young Blake sits in a derelict Saigon bar, mean drunk. His face is devoid of his trademark scar. You'd think this country'd had enough goddamn fireworks. If we'd've lost this war, I think it might have driven us crazy, y'know? As a country. But we didn't. Thanks to you.
answer: You sound bitter.

question: Me? I think it's hilarious. Fantastic. Just what I need. There's nothing to talk about cuz I'm leaving. I'm gonna forget you and your horrible, sweaty little country. He turns away. Her eyes blaze with betrayal and hatred. You bitch! My face! He PUSHES HER into the bar and DRAWS HIS PISTOL--
answer: Blake . don't. BLAM! Blake shoots her; the Girl SLAMS against the far wall. She drops, dead. Blake. She was pregnant. You gunned her down. Blake turns on him, spitting fury.

question: Justice doesn't matter, alright? Because twenty years from now we're all gonna be dust. Mankind's been trying to kill each other off since the beginning of time and now we finally got the power to finish the job. Ain't nothin' gonna matter when the nukes start flying, and I promise you they will. Then Ozymandias here is gonna be the smartest man on the cinder. He sneers and walks out. Silence. Uncomfortable in the wake of truth, the others pack up to go, muttering apologies to Adrian, but Adrian ignores them, staring at the flames flickering across his face. He seems more thoughtful than upset. MATCH CUT TO: Crawl back in yer holes before you get hurt! I got rubber bullets! Okay, that's how you wanna do it?! Smiling grimly, he FIRES TEAR GAS CANNISTERS INTO THE CROWD.
answer: Oh God. Comedian, this is a nightmare! The whole city is erupting!

question: Hah! You seen this? The smoke clears enough for Dan to see a message SPRAY- PAINTED on a brick wall
answer: How long can we keep this up?

question: My government contacts tell me they're pushing some new bill through Congress. Until then, we're society's only protection.
answer: Protection from what? Blake laughs, exultant in the blowing smoke, the chaos.

question: Edgar William Jacobi. Also known as Edgar William Vaughn. Also known as William Edgar Bright. Also known as Moloch.
answer: What are you talking about? I'm a retired business maaAAAHHH!

question: Lie again, I'll break your arm.
answer: Oh God, please. I did my time. I'm not Moloch anymore. What do you want from me? Rorschach lets him go. Moloch's hollow eyes follow him.

question: You attended a funeral today. Why?
answer: The funeral? I don't know why I went. I just felt I should. I'd been thinking about the Comedian-- Rorschach SLAMS Moloch against the wall.

question: How did you know Blake was the Comedian?
answer: He broke in here! A week ago! He, he had his mask off. He was drunk--

question: You were enemies for forty years. Why would he visit you?
answer: I don't know! I woke up in my bedroom and there he was! He was upset! Crying!

question: The Comedian? Crying?
answer: He, he was babbling, not making sense. I was pissing in my pants--I thought he was going to kill me!

question: What did he say?!
answer: He said he was wrong. About it all being a joke, that it wasn't funny anymore. He said he was scared--

question: Scared of what?!
answer: Something he saw, I think. He said something about wishing he never broke into that building. But that he had to keep his mouth shut. Then, then he left! Rorschach studies Moloch a moment, then releases him.

question: Hm. Funny story. Sounds unbelievable. Probably true. Rorschach glances around the kitchen. He opens some drawers, looking inside. He picks up a stack of MAIL, flips through it. One of the envelopes contains a PENSION CHECK from "Pyramid Industries."
answer: So that's it? I'm clean?

question: Clean? I searched your house. Found illegal drugs.
answer: Illegal--I don't use drugs. Rorschach pulls a PILL BOTTLE from his coat.

question: Laetril. Phony medication made from apricot pits. Illegal.
answer: oh c-come on. Look, please don't confiscate that. I'm trying anything . I have cancer.

question: What kind of cancer?
answer: The kind you don't get better from.

question: Hey, your finger, it's like licking a battery. It's all-- She opens her eyes. They widen in shock and horror as she sees TWO DR. MANHATTANS in bed with her. Oh God! That's horrible! Stop it! Laurie jumps up. The two Dr. Manhattans stand, confused. I'm sorry, I--You startled me, that's all Forget about it. I overreacted. It was just strange to see-- Laurie can now see into the KITCHEN, where yet a THIRD DR. MANHATTAN is working on an experiment. Her eyes blaze. How long have you been working in here? Understand!? You're working in here at the same time we're in bed!? Shut up! Just SHUT YOUR MOUTH! Laurie WHIPS a full BEAKER at 3's chest. It PASSES THROUGH HIM and SMASHES IN THE KITCHEN SINK. Laurie storms out. Human emotion? You were human once. That's the problem, Jon. You've forgotten that.
answer: Who is it?

question: It's Laurie.
answer: Laurie? It takes a few moments for him to open the door. Sorry, I had a new lock installed, it's a little sticky--

question: I left Jon.
answer: Did, uh, the Secret Service follow you here?

question: I lost them in the subways. I think.
answer: I'm really sorry, Laurie.

question: Living with him . Dan, you don't know what it's been like. INTERCUT TO I hope I didn't ruin your night.
answer: Not at all. I was just going to see Hollis for our weekly beer session. You're more than welcome to join. In fact, I insist They pass the news stand from the opening scene. The Homeless Man is arguing with the News Vendor:

question: Is this dark enough? Thank you. It was my duty. CUT TO
answer: Dr. Manhattan, Doug Roth, Nova Times. Do you remember a man named Wally Weaver?

question: Yes, he was a good friend of mine. When we were both physicists.
answer: He died of cancer.

question: I remember. I attended his funeral.
answer: How about Edgar Jacobi, also known as the supervillian Moloch? You had a lot of battles with him, didn't you? Did you know that he has cancer as-well? The News Host looks confused. Adrian turns to the Press Agent, growing concerned with where this is leading. CUT TO

question: I was not aware--
answer: And what about Jose Flores? He was the longtime janitor at the Watchmen Headquarters where you worked for many years. Cancer.

question: By your line of questioning, you're suggesting that I was the cause of cancer in these individuals.
answer: You tell me, doc. Adrian turns to him.

question: It is irrelevant whether I was the cause or not.
answer: Irrelevant?

question: A live human body and a dead human body have the same number of particles. Structurally there's no difference. An appalled then angry buzz comes over the audience.
answer: What about Janey Slater? Do you think it makes a difference to her?

question: Janey Slater? Wh--
answer: Your ex-girlfriend, she was a physicist too. You were with her for ten years. Or does she have to remind you herself? Suddenly Janey Slater emerges from a door at the top of the stands. She is old now, frail, barely recognizable from the images we've see of her. She has cancer as well. Doctors have given her six months. What do you have to say, Ms. Slater? He sticks the microphone in her face.

question: You're late.
answer: I know, you won't believe it--

question: You missed it--Dr. Manhattan just lost it on live TV.
answer: Wait, what? Dan turns to the TV, which replays the clip of Dr. Manhattan being accosted and then teleporting everyone to the roof. I was just with Laurie. She doesn't know.

question: Laurel? Laurel Jane? Startled, Laurie turns. Blake steps out of the shadows. You're Sally Jupiter's kid.
answer: You're the Comedian, right? You were pretty cool in there. Blake lights a smoke, looks her over.

question: You got your mom's eyes. Even that funny little mole.
answer: Got another smoke?

question: She was one of the all-time champion beauties, your mom. She talk about me much?
answer: No. Not really. As Blake gives her a light, Laurie touches his hand to cover the lighter from the wind. She looks up at him, sly.

question: Ms. Jupiter, you need to come with us now.
answer: I don't understand, what do you mean, Jon's gone?

question: I mean he snapped and disappeared during the interview. Now our trackers can't detect him anywhere on the planet. If we want to find him you're our only hope. A TECHNICIAN wires Laurie up; GRAPHS record Laurie's neural responses, MONITORS show satellite images.
answer: No. Jon? Jon, can you hear me? The GRAPH-NEEDLES jump and tick, searching . when a high, clear TONE rings through the room. Needles fly. Technicians dash to lock it down. Agent Forbes hurries to the graph, looking over their shoulders.

question: Aww, Jon, look--you've got cotton candy on the side of your mouth
answer: You do too. Here, let me get it for you. He pulls her close. They giggle like the young lovers they are and then kiss, passionate BACK TO Janey? What's wrong?

question: The time lock, Jon! As it dawns on Jon, he hears the hum of the REACTOR INITIATING, the big mechanical parts moving. Jon runs to the door, BANGS on it.
answer: Janey

question: I'm sorry, Jon, I can't-- Janey can't bear to watch--she runs out of the lab as the reactor initiates
answer: JANEY! . and with a BLINDING FLASH--Jon and his watch are OBLITERATED to bits . BACK TO

question: Clock's ticking, Mr. Veidt.
answer: I know. I'm meeting the toy people, yes?

question: Eleven-thirty. They want to talk to you about some new villains for the "Ozymandias" line.
answer: All the old villains are dead.

question: What's with everybody today? Everyone's on this death trip.
answer: I suppose the threat of war has that effect. ACROSS THE WAY, Dan enters the building, intercepts Adrian.

question: I suppose the threat of war has that effect. ACROSS THE WAY, Dan enters the building, intercepts Adrian.
answer: Adrian, I need to talk to you. Adrian looks put off.

question: Dan, I'm sorry, this is a bad time.
answer: But what about what happened with ion? Adrian excuses himself from his Assistant.

question: Jon's departure is terrible. Not only for what's happening in the world now, but for what could have happened. The energy project he and I were working on--it's dead now .
answer: Rorschach came to see me again. Maybe there's something to this mask killer thing.

question: Are you still preoccupied with the ramblings of that lunatic? I really don't have time for this, Dan.
answer: Adrian! BANG! The man SHOOTS the Assistant in the gut; Adrian immediately springs into action--he moves with unbelievable speed and quickness, grabbing a velvet ROPE-STANCHION-- --DEFLECTING A SECOND BULLET with it-- --and SMASHING IT INTO THE FACE OF THE ASSASSIN, knocking him into a FOUNTAIN. SECURITY GUARDS run, guns drawn, toward the fountain where Adrian GRAPPLES with the dazed man.

question: Oh my god. Where's Adrian now?
answer: Talking to the cops. Thank god he's still in great shape. You get so caught up with the whole smartest man in the world thing you forget what a physical specimen he is- -he's as fast as I've ever seen him

question: I'm not sure. I can't go stay with my mom- -I'm sure that's the first place they'll look. But I need to get out of the city. It's only a matter of time before they find me.
answer: Listen, why don't you . how about you stay at my place?

question: Oh, Dan, I couldn't impose--
answer: It wouldn't be an imposition, I have an extra room. We're friends. And with everything that's been happening

question: You're buying into Rorschach's "mask killer" theory?
answer: I don't know. But it can't hurt to be safe. Besides, I've already had one wanted person visit me, another one won't make a difference. They look at each other. Laurie smiles.

question: Rorschach's Journal, October 19th. Someone tried to kill Adrian Veidt. Proves mask killer theory--the murderer is closing in. Pyramid Industries is the key. Rorschach approaches a TRASH CAN. He rummages through it and finds an ENVELOPE. He opens it and finds a NOTE that reads Checked mail drop, got a message from Moloch. Was just going to pay him a visit. Rorschach turns down an alley, approaches a DUMPSTER. He reaches behind the dumpster. Somebody tried to shoot the world's smartest man today, Moloch. Moloch sits at the kitchen table. CLOSE ON The hitman worked for Pyramid Industries. So did Janey Slater and everyone else Dr. Manhattan allegedly gave cancer to. And last time I was here, I saw a pension check sent to you from the same company-- obviously a front set up by whoever it is that killed the Comedian, that pushed Dr. Manhattan over the edge, that wants us masks dead. Is that why you left me a note in my mail drop? You have something to confess? Rorschach turns. A HOLE gapes between Moloch's staring eyes. A PISTOL lies on the table--Moloch's dead. Rorschach carefully pulls the NOTE from Moloch's hand. It's the note Rorschach had left in Moloch's refrigerator, the one that reads No. No. No, no, no
answer: IF THERE'S ANYONE IN THERE WITH YOU, SEND

question: Framed. Set up. Walked right into it. Stupid, stupid, stupid.
answer: LET'S MAKE THIS A NICE, CLEAN SURRENDER.

question: Heh. Never. Never surrender. Rorschach takes an AEROSOL CAN and a PEPPER SHAKER.
answer: ALRIGHT. I HOPE YOU'RE READY, "HERO." Rorschach's mask DISAPPEARS back into darkness.

question: When you are
answer: We've got him. There's no way out. From the second floor, Rorschach SMASHES THROUGH THE WINDOW, snarling like a rabid dog, landing hard on the concrete. His ankle TWISTS, dropping him to the ground. Rorschach struggles to get to his feet. When he looks up he finds TWENTY COPS IN A SEMI-CIRCLE before him. A loaded, pregnant pause. The COPS RUSH FORWARD.

question: That mask's eaten Rorschach's brains away.
answer: He wasn't always like that. We were a great team--tactically, he was brilliant. But I don't know, something about this murder charge I just can't see Rorschach shooting Moloch.

question: He shot a cop with a grappling gun.
answer: Don't remind me, I made that thing for him. But a regular gun just seems too . ordinary

question: And this war, god. Sometimes I wish I could just leave the planet. Like Jon.
answer: Oh sure. The old Manhattan Transfer.

question: Now, that's funny. That's what you call Jon's teleportation?
answer: Well, not to his face. Laurie laughs.

question: Walter Kovacs. Is that your name? Walter?
answer: No. The Psychiatrist sits back, considering Rorschach carefully.

question: Let me explain your situation here, Walter. If you cooperate with me, I may be able to convince them that you should to be treated medically, in a hospital, which I believe is best for you. But the authorities want to put you in General Population.
answer: A prison is a prison.

question: Yes, but the difference is, downstairs? They'll eat you alive. He holds up a RORSCHACH BLOT-CARD. Now . . tell me what you see. FLASH OF
answer: A pretty butterfly. The Psychiatrist holds up another blot-card.

question: How about this one? What do you see here? FLASH OF
answer: Some nice flowers. The Psychiatrist eyes him, dubious. Holds up another card. FLASH OF Clouds. The Psychiatrist sighs, puts the cards down.

question: Tell me about Rorschach. Will you do that?
answer: Why are you here with me, doctor?

question: Because I want to make you well.
answer: There's other men in here with behavior more extreme than mine. Of course, they're not famous. You want to know about Rorschach, doctor? I'll tell you about Rorschach Men get arrested. Rorschach RAISES THE CLEAVER, high over his head A tremor of impact shook my arm. Warm blood splashed my face. It was Walter Kovacs who screamed, who closed his eyes-- it was Rorschach who opened them again. The silence reels out RORSCHACH You see, Doctor. God didn't kill that little girl, fate didn't butcher her and destiny didn't feed her to those dogs. If God saw what any of us did that night, he didn't seem to mind. From then on, I knew. God doesn't make the world this way. We do. The Psychiatrist rises shakily. He crosses to the GUARD.

question: I can't help him.
answer: None of you understand. I'm not locked up in here with you. Rorschach is placidly dragged off INTO DARKNESS You're locked up in here with me.

question: All these gadgets and there isn't even a dash lighter She hits a BUTTON--the lights inside go DIM. Creepy. She hits the button again to turn the lights back on but nothing
answer: Laurie?! Dan BOLTS for the basement door, thoughts of the mask-killer on his mind. LAURIE! Dan grabs a FIRE EXTINGUISHER. Where are you?! Dan SPRAYS the fire. Laurie stumbles from the smoke, out of the Owl-Ship. Dan's got the fire under control now.

question: I'm so sorry--I hit the wrong button. I was looking for the lighter in.there.
answer: I don't smoke. Are you hurt?

question: I'm fine, but your ship--
answer: Ah, that's mostly just soot. Archie's pretty resilient.

question: Archie? Still with the mask-killer theory? Rorschach is insane.
answer: Maybe, but the Comedian murdered; Jon exiled; Someone tries to shoot Adrian; Rorschach gets arrested. It makes me uneasy.

question: How did you ever afford all this?
answer: My Dad was in corporate banking. He left me quite a bit. Which always surprised me.

question: How did he die?
answer: Mugging. He was shot. As Dan cleans up, Laurie watches him, like she's seeing him for the first time.

question: You really do worry about me, don't you?
answer: Huh? Well, yeah, of course I worry about you, I mean, we're, y'know, friends-- Laurie takes off his glasses . and KISSES him. It's what Dan's been wanting all this time . but he pulls away. Sorry, I

question: It's been a long time, Rorschach. Rorschach turns to see TWO THUGS standing side by side, one muscle bound, the other very fat, staring at him through the bars. PAN DOWN
answer: Big Figure. Small world.

question: I like that. But you know, it is a small world in here. I've been in it for--how long now, Billy? That's right. Twenty years since you and that owl fella put me away. Rorschach-- that guy you burned is dying. Could go any minute now. And when he does, this place is gonna explode. Then you die by inches.
answer: Tall order.

question: Dan? Is everything okay? I heard you coming down the stairs Descending the stairs, she finds Dan before his costume, naked. He fiddles with an OWL-WING THROWING WEAPON.
answer: Mask killers. War. Nuclear annihilation. I feel so powerless, so I've been afraid of this damn costume. Afraid of how much I need it. He FLINGS the owl wing crescent, whizzing into the dark.

question: So. Let's take the ship out.
answer: What?

question: Who's to know? I used to be a "masked avenger" too, remember? I'm used to getting up at three in the morning to do something stupid. Besides, I'm already a wanted lady, you're already in trouble for hiding me, how much more trouble can we be in? Just give me a second--can't go out like this. She jogs upstairs. Dan turns to the empty, waiting suit.
answer: I can't believe it still fits. Luckily I constructed it with material that was elastic and-- Dan turns as Laurie appears at the door, decked in her BLACK SPANDEX. SILK SPECTRE, looking every bit as good as seventeen- --form fitting

question: I'm ready. Dan turns and sees his reflection in the owl-Ship's window.
answer: Me too.

question: It's so beautiful
answer: Hang on. Dan BANKS, wheeling the ship toward the VELDT BUILDING. Got to clean her up a bit. I'm sure Adrian wouldn't want to impede the course of justice. Heading straight for the building, Dan JIGS at the last moment, flying the ship THROUGH THE V-SHAPED WATERFALL in the skyscraper's center. The water washes clean the years of dust. The Owl-Ship emerges, sparkling like new.

question: Look! Below, a TENEMENT BUILDING is ENGULFED IN FLAME. Dan's jaw sets. He wheels the ship around and down. As they zoom closer, they can see people SCREAMING from the windows. There's children in there!
answer: I'm putting the water cannons on the lower stories.

question: I can't believe we did that! That was actually fun
answer: Yeah. He puts a hand on her shoulder. His eyes locked onto hers. He knows what he wants and this time he's not afraid of it He kisses her. Hard. Running her hands up his cheeks, they slide each other's masks off. Their mouths melt together.

question: It was good, wasn't it?
answer: Yeah, saving those people from the fire. Taking Archie out Laurie swats him on the chest--that's not what she meant. Dan grins, having fun with her. It--you were unbelievable. They kiss.

question: So . what do we do next? Dan sits up, serious. Very serious.
answer: I've been thinking about that. And I believe we have certain obligations to our fraternity.

question: All the more reason we need to get to the bottom of this. Maybe we can get Jon to come back in the process and stop all this madness.
answer: Nothing we do will bring Jon back! But I think you know that already. And breaking Rorschach out of prison certainly isn't the answer.

question: Rorschach's been the only one investigating this from the start. Without him, we're starting at the beginning and we don't have that kind of time. We need your help, Adrian.
answer: I'm leaving, Dan. And I suggest you both do the same. Adrian pulls on a thick WINTER COAT and heads upstairs.

question: Where are you going to go?
answer: Antarctica. It takes Dan a moment to realize Adrian is serious. By then, Adrian's halfway into the helicopter. Good luck, Dan. He says it sincerely. Dan watches the helicopter fly off.

question: You don't have to do this. I know the whole crimefighting thing wasn't necessarily your choice in life.
answer: No. But this is. She moves next to him. But I'm not doing it for Rorschach or even for Jon. And I'm sure as hell not doing if for the Comedian. They look at each other--Dan knows who she's doing it for. The Owl-Ship is upon the prison now Look! They see a RIOT below--Inmates spilling out into the yard, overwhelming the Correctional Officers on the ground; TOWER GUARDS take shots at some of the Inmates; Broken glass, broken furniture parts scattered through the yard; SMOKE emits from inside the prison.

question: Hmm, Rorschach gets locked up in here and suddenly there's a riot. I wonder if that's a coincidence. They descend toward the hell of TEAR-GAS, FIRE and VIOLENCE. The Tower Guards, stunned at the sight of the Owl-Ship, begin SHOOTING at it. The bullets bounce right off. Put your ear-plugs in.
answer: How are we going to find Rorschach in all of this?

question: When he and I were partners, we each had tracking implants put under our skin so old Archie here could find us if either one of us were ever in trouble. Let's see if Rorschach kept his in. Dan turns on the GPS monitor. There's a BLIP on the screen. He's in that wing. Dan steers the ship toward the Maximum Security Wing. 9
answer: How do we know he's still alive? They come upon Rorschach's cell. Dan sees the SMOKING CORPSE of Dumb Thug. Sees the CUT OFF HANDS of Fat Thug, HANGING from the bars.

question: He's alive.
answer: Is that--

question: We can leave now. He walks off.
answer: Are you sure you're ready? We don't want to go diving head-first into things.

question: Good Advice. I'm sure there are many who'd agree with you. Behind them Good to see you in uniform, Daniel. What happened? Finally taking the mask-killer seriously?
answer: I'm not.

question: Of course you haven't been attacked yet. Funny, most everyone else has.
answer: What's that supposed to mean? We came here to rescue you, asshole!

question: Hey! Survive now! Argue later! I had to turn the screechers off, so we'll be drawing fire. The owl-Ship rises to the roof. They all jump in. Rorschach, you remember how to handle Archie?
answer: I believe so. Rorschach sits in the pilot's seat. Dan turns to Laurie, high on adrenaline and love. Dan moves in to kiss her-- Daniel.

question: Give us a second--
answer: I don't think this can wait.

question: It `s him. The ship COLLIDES with Dr. Manhattan, who PASSES THROUGH into the CABIN with a SHOWER of BLUE PARTICLES--
answer: Hello Laurie.

question: They said you were on Mars.
answer: I am on Mars. You and I are about to have a conversation there.

question: Where? What are you talking about?
answer: You are going to try to convince me to save the world.

question: I hate this. How long are we going to stay down here? Daniel! Dan says nothing. Rorschach puts on his costume. You're letting fear paralyze you. And that woman--
answer: Hey! We took enough unnecessary risks bringing Archie up so you could get your spare costume. We stay put until it cools down out there--they're looking for us.

question: Unnecessary? Cowering in the sludge, from the authorities, that's unnecessary. Rorschach pulls his mask on, turns. While we waste time, the mask-killer gets closer. We need to get to Pyramid Industries. Dan sits at the COMPUTER.
answer: I know, you told me already. I'm tapping into all the databases, finding out about the company--

question: Sitting at a computer? No. We need to trace the killer--hit up underworld contacts, squeeze people. You've forgotten how we do things. You've been lazing around too long.
answer: Listen, I HAVE HAD IT! Who the hell do you think you are? You live off people while insulting them, and no one complains because they think you're a goddamn lunatic! Dan turns away, shaking. He leans against the console. I'm sorry. I shouldn't have said that. Maybe you're right, maybe--

question: You are a good friend. I'm sorry that it is sometimes difficult with me. Touched, Dan shakes his hand. An awkward, lovely moment.
answer: Hey forget it It's okay, man. Releasing his hand with some effort, Dan sits, invigorated. You're right. It's time to head up.

question: Our conversation commences when you surprise me with the information that you and Dreiberg have been sleeping together.
answer: You . know about me and Dan?

question: Not yet. But in a few moments, you're going to tell me.
answer: Jon, I'm having enough problems right now without getting into your predestination crap.

question: Why does my perception of time distress you so?
answer: Because. If you already know the future, why were you surprised when I left you, or when that reporter ambushed you? Why even debate if you already know the outcome?

question: Because everything is pre-ordained. Even my responses.
answer: Agh! This is so typical of you! Do you know what a relief it is to be with somebody human, like Dan?

question: You mean you're sleeping with Dan Dreiberg? Contemplating this, he steps to the balcony's edge.
answer: But you already know . You said--

question: I said, often, that you were my only remaining link with the world. Now that link is shattered. Don't you see the futility of asking me to save a world that I no longer have any stake in?
answer: That's ridiculous. The Earth is too important to hinge on one relationship.

question: Not to me. My red world here means more to me than your blue one. I'll show you around if you like. The giant Glass Palace begins to RUMBLE.
answer: Are you doing this? I'm not in the mood for jokes.

question: You sure this is the correct location, Daniel?
answer: Positive. Pyramid Industries. Specializes in industrial plastics. At least they did. I tapped into all the databases--tax records, business registries, real estate records--trying to get a bead on who's behind Pyramid but it's a never ending paper trail. Rorschach investigates ahead when Dan catches some MOVEMENT-- --he turns his FLASHLIGHT to find a few HOMELESS PEOPLE squatting in the warehouse. Upon seeing Dan in.costume, the Homeless People run away.

question: Daniel.
answer: They're harmless, Rorschach.

question: Daniel. Rorschach is looking down at something. Dan heads over and sees a DEAD BODY in the early stages of decomposition. He turns the body over--bullet between the eyes just like Moloch . but we recognize the corpse--it's journalist Doug Roth.
answer: Hey, I know this man.

question: Yes. Doug Roth. Journalist who grilled Dr. Manhattan on national television.
answer: No I didn't watch that interview. This was the guy who was doing a story on Adrian when I went to see him.

question: Hmm. Journalist set up Dr. Manhattan, was probably working to set up Veidt also. Dan stands there thinking. As if hit with an epiphany. He opens his mouth like he can't believe what he's going to say.
answer: Rorschach. What, what if it's Adrian?

question: Veidt? Behind everything? Makes no sense.
answer: On the surface it doesn't, but hear me out--Adrian's the only one who could've taken on the Comedian in hand to hand combat. He's the only one with the finances to create an entire company for the sole purpose of setting up Dr. Manhattan. And Adrian was directly involved in arranging that broadcast. He probably supplied this journalist with the whole cancer list.

question: That doesn't explain the attempt on Veidt's life.
answer: If we say that Adrian set that up himself, he could've had the hitman shoot his assistant first. It was a risk, but--

question: But why?
answer: I don't know. Let's go ask him.

question: Can't you just tell me how this all ends and save us the trouble?
answer: It ends with you in tears.

question: Tears. You mean I lose? You don't come back to Earth?
answer: I return to Earth at some point. The streets are filled with death.

question: You mean there's going to be a war? An actual, nuclear war?
answer: I can't be sure. I'm still experiencing some static interference preventing any clear vision of what lies ahead.

question: Static?
answer: Tachyon particles. Tachyons are a rare occurrence. The detonation of nuclear warheads could conceivably be the cause.

question: Jon, you've got to stop it! Everyone will die!
answer: And the universe will not even notice. See the dual moons. Aren't they breathtaking? Above, TWO MOONS cross overhead. One is HUGE, CRIMSON RED, the smaller is a delicate SHELL PINK. Spectacular.

question: You're right, Jon--what does human life matter next to a, a neutrino. Look, I'm not going to debate you when you clearly don't see anything terribly miraculous about life. I guess quantum physics doesn't allow for miracles.
answer: No, thermodynamic miracles are--

question: Oh God, Jon. Land this thing. Now.
answer: On the Argyre Planitia? As you wish. The structure descends. Laurie stomps down the stairs.

question: That's it then. You can send me back to Earth to fry with Dan and my Mom and all the other worthless humans. And look, you were wrong. You said this ended with me in tears and see? Not a damp eye in the house. Maybe you're wrong about everything.
answer: Laurie. You complain that I refuse to see life on life's terms. And yet you continuously refuse to see things from my perspective. If only you'd try to see the whole continuum, life's pattern, you'd understand. But you deliberately shut it out as if afraid to see.

question: I'm not afraid, okay? You want me to see things your way? Go ahead, do that thing you do. She stands there, arms folded, waiting. Then, just like earlier in the lab, Jon touches her head--
answer: You wanted to hear it, so I'm telling you, okay?. Magic! Dreams! That's what I had before. I was a hero goddammit! It was a mistake--one time! Am I never-- And then they notice Laurie looking at them.

question: Mommy?
answer: Oh. Oh, Laurie

question: No. No, no, no, no not him
answer: The comedian was your father.

question: But he--
answer: Attacked your mother. Yes. Two years later he came back to her, to make amends. And you were conceived on that day.

question: NO!!I Laurie WHIPS a BOTTLE at the palace-- --and the huge glass construction CRUMBLES. Jon protects them with a FORCE FIELD as debris collapses around them. Laurie sobs in the echoing SILENCE. Jon's eyes SHUT. He seems to feel . empathy. A TEAR slips down his cheek. Laurie's realization is a revelation for ion. The comedian is my father. I guess my life is just one big joke.
answer: I don't think your life is a joke.

question: Well, of course you're going to say that.
answer: But I've changed my mind. There are miracles in your world that are worth preserving.

question: What? But you were saying--
answer: I tried to explain. Thermodynamic miracles--events with odds against so astronomical, like oxygen turning into gold. I have longed to witness such a thing and yet I neglect that in human coupling, millions upon millions of cells compete to create life over generation after generation

question: But if my birth is a miracle you, you could say that about anyone.
answer: Yes, anyone in the world. But the world is so crowded with miracles that they become commonplace and we forget. I forget. They stand there in silence. Connected for the first time in years. Now. Dry your eyes. FROM ABOVE

question: Mind your manners.
answer: Adrian, don't make me-- Adrian picks up a GOLDEN SERVING TRAY off the table as Dan FIRES. Adrian DEFLECTS the laser with the tray-- --then DISCUS-SLINGS the tray into Dan's NOSE. Blood SPRAYS, Dan drops to his knees. Adrian turns his back on them, calm.

question: Now. What can I do for you?
answer: You know! You killed the Comedian! You set up Rorschach! You created Pyramid Industries, hired all those people, gave them cancer and blamed it on Jon!

question: Yes.
answer: Dammit Adrian, what are you trying to do?

question: What we always intended--to improve the world. As Adrian speaks, Rorschach sneaks up behind him, with a FORK. He tries to stab Adrian in the back, but Adrian effortlessly dodges the blow, GRABS Rorschach's mask, TWISTS it, then KNEES him in the gut. Rorschach drops to the floor. Adrian starts walking out of the hall. Dan helps Rorschach up and they follow. I never intended to kill the Comedian-- that was an accident. Part of his duties as a government operative was to keep track of all former masked heroes, make sure there was no rocking of the boat. He must have liked Rorschach because he allowed him to continue to exist. I had thought that the Comedian might be incompetent, but he disproved that hypothesis when he discovered what was really going on. here in Karnak--no easy task. Even my staff was unaware--I made sure to keep each department separate. The Comedian was appalled by my plan, but still, he understood the scope of what I was trying to accomplish. Frankly, I never thought he'd actually talk. But by the time he visited poor Moloch, he was cracking badly. So I had to kill him. After Blake, I neutralized Jon--a plan nearly a decade in the works after analyzing confidential psychological profiles which predicted his withdrawal from human existence. By then, Rorschach's mask theory, 'though erroneous, needed to be addressed, so I faked my own assassination--
answer: Why take that risk? What if the hitman shot you first instead of your assistant?

question: I suppose I'd have to be fast enough to catch the bullet then, wouldn't I? Adrian smiles enigmatically. After apprehending my own assassin, I shoved a cyanide capsule in his mouth, disposing of him, and soon after that, the journalist Doug Roth, tying up all the loose ends if you will. Then I knew nothing stood in the way of my triumph.
answer: Triumph? Adrian, what are you going to do?

question: I'm firing a beam of concentrated energy, synthesized from Dr. Manhattan himself, into the hearts of nine key regions around the globe, crossing all traditional politics and ideologies; Paris, Tehran, Kashmir, Beijing, Taiwan, Pyongyang, London, Jerusalem, New York-- destroying approximately three million people.
answer: Three million people? You're joking.

question: THIS IS DR. MANHATTAN. FOR YEARS, I HAVE
answer: God Jon, what was that? Jon looks around the street. Even he is awe-struck.

question: Interference. Cataclysmic interference. Laurie looks up and screams. THOUSANDS OF BLACK SILHOUETTES are IMPRINTED on the STREET and the WALLS. Everywhere. There is no rubble--some buildings have simply disintegrated.
answer: Was it a war? It doesn't seem like--

question: Not a war. I .don't know what it was. Dr. Manhattan looks up into the sky, studying it.
answer: Take me out of here, Jon. Please.

question: I'm sorry. This must be very upsetting for you. I have traced the source of the Tachyon particles to Antarctica. Shall we?
answer: Anywhere. Anywhere's better than here.

question: Adrian, of course. Who else would have the resources
answer: Wait, this is Adrian's compound? Are you saying he's responsible for this-- Jon walks toward the building, entranced. Distracted.

question: Yes. Yes, he killed Blake and millions of others. Excuse me, Daniel, I'm talking to Laurie ninety seconds ago
answer: What, Daniel? Millions of others? Jon don't start that crap now, not here!

question: What's on your mind, Dan?
answer: Your death.

question: Really. You want to kill me?
answer: Yeah. You might have created peace, but not at the expense of justice. You need to pay for what you've done.

question: That doesn't sound like you, Dan. That sounds more like Rorschach.
answer: Exactly. Adrian readies himself. Laurie breaks away from the TV screens.

question: Only you're not Rorschach, are you now? How do you expect to succeed where he failed?
answer: Tell you the truth, Adrian. I don't. Dan FLIES at Adrian, fighting like a madman for his life. His fighting style has changed. Dan's newfound brutality is informed by everything he's learned from Rorschach. About justice. About life. But Adrian is the best. He takes Dan's attacks apart with ease, delivering blows which would kill a man not quite so focused on his goal. In the end, he CATCHES Dan's final strike and TWISTS. Dan's arm SNAPS easily.

question: You sure you don't want a drink?
answer: I'm okay. Thanks. We finally see Laurie now--her hair dyed, appearance changed. Mom--I just want to get this out of the way . . I know Eddie Blake, the Comedian--I know he was my father. Sally freezes. I remember. Sally downs her drink, immediately starts making another.

question: It, it was years later, he stopped by out of the blue, and, and apologized. I don't know, I just couldn't stay mad. It just happened-- Laurie kisses her mother's teary cheek.
answer: Mom. People's lives take them strange places. You never did anything wrong by me. Sally jumps as a CLICK/WHIR SOUND comes from a BOOKCASE.

question: What the hell is that?
answer: Oh that's Dan. Home from "work." The bookcase SLIDES ASIDE and a blond DAN enters from the secret ELEVATOR. He is trim and confident, cheeks flushed with color. Buttoning up his shirt, he spots Sally.

question: Any bad guys last night?
answer: There are always bad guys. Even in today's world. Slow, Laurie turns to the window. Looks out at the New York skyline being rebuilt.

question: Dan.
answer: Hmm?

question: Will it be alright? The world, I mean. He puts his arm around her shoulder.
answer: As long as no-one ever finds out that Adrian was behind it all, the public will think ion is still up there, watching. The threat remains, and everything should be fine.
